subject: Re: [junit] How can I test a method with @Test in a method?
msgSnippet: ... Hi, I m not sure I quite follow. Do you mean perhaps that you d like to specify dependencies between tests; i.e. if test A fails, then don t bother running
messageBody:
2009/4/24 johnsu123 <johnsu123@...>:
>
>
> The example code is following:
> @Test(expected = NullPointerException.class)
> public void f(){
> String s = null;
> System.out.println(s.length());
> }
>
> @Test
> public void g(){
> f();
> }
> I want to test g() only. And if f() in g() is tested ok, it's also ok in
> g(). If the test of f() is failed, the global test is failed too.
> I want that the result based on beyond code succeed, but it is failed.What
> can I do if I want to accomplish that function?
> Thanks a lot!

Hi,

I'm not sure I quite follow. Do you mean perhaps that you'd like to
specify dependencies between tests; i.e. if test A fails, then don't
bother running tests B, C, D and E?

Could you try to re-state the problem that you're trying to solve so
that we can have a better understanding and give you a more accurate
answer?

Cheers,

James
